Author: Jo Ferreday
Post Text: How often do you #dogoodthings in your business?What I truly love is working with businesses that make it their sole purpose.I'd like to say a HUGE thank you to Paddy & Scott's for supporting one of our corporate clients virtual coffee tasting event last night.I've been watching the Paddy and Scotts story for some time and think they have created an amazing brand making a considerable impact.A few facts about them if you are not aware;Created in 2007, by Paddy, Scott and a black Lab named JessieThey're a small UK based, for-profit business that believes in sharing these profits with the families and communities that grow our coffee. They  believe that doing good is good for business, where commerce can be a driver for change.They've launched another mad world-first project to fund school meals in coffee growing regions around the world. Every bag of Lunch Box coffee they sell provides a meal for a child who needs it most.Paddy & Scotts Muchomba Project - KenyaThis award winning, ground breaking project was set up as a commercial joint venture with Paddy & Scott‚Äôs and a Kenyan smallholding coffee farm headed by George and Issac Muchomba back in 2017. Since 2017 the project has expanded to produce enough coffee to fill over 1m cups per year.The proceeds of the sale of this coffee has helped build a school, provide fresh running water, washing and sanitation facilities. They have also helped build a commercially viable supply chain that ensures Issac Muchomba‚Äôs children can carry on making a living from growing coffee for many years to come.  Currently, their farm project produces approx. 10% of the coffee they need to supply their customers, they are working on making that 100%.Sustainability wise there's some great efforts being made;Since 2004 all their coffee packaging has been made from aluminium free PET recyclable material. Their paper cups are compostable, their lids are made from corn starch and their coffee bags are made from compostable potato starch. Even our business cards are made from recycled crew t-shirts. All Paddy & Scott's deliveries from orders from their website are now Carbon Neutral. They do this by working with Shopify to calculate how much Carbon each delivery will emit and then funding several world leading schemes which take Carbon out of the atmosphere, to make sure the same amount of Carbon is captured. They fund this themselves and do not pass the costs on to their customers, as they believe this is the right thing to do and because they want their coffee to be a force for good in the world, not something that harms it!Their coffee tastes better because it changes lives. Literally.Why share all this info about another business instead of info about my own business?Why not? Didn't you read the first line of the post, do good things. When people do that, its important to shout out about it!#business #thankyou #coffee #changinglives #events #changeforgood #virtualevents #sustainability

Author: Jo Ferreday
Post Text: How often do you reflect on your year personally and professionally?I'm not a typical person who set goals for myself and the business once a year and then forgets about them.NoYou see, I believe in order to achieve our goals individually and as a collective in a business, we need; ConsistencyDeterminationEnthusiasm (even on the days you don't feel like it)Honesty and transparency with ourself and othersEach year for the past twenty years I have set myself personal goals and in the business set out what the plan is for the year.Reviewing sometimes quarterly, six monthly and then annually.This year I have done things quite differently though;Listening to my body and mind - If I've had an off day, I've been kind to myself, taken myself off for a walk or run getting out in nature has been one of the key things this year.  I've also sought to understand what didn't go so well, made a plan for what could be improved and started a fresh the next day.  Years ago, a bad day would have turned into a bad week, month etc. Now its just a blip and something to learn from.Tackling situations independently - Rather than trying to take on multiple goals together, I've broken them down, tackling them independently then moving on to the next.Taking extra care of my health, fitness and wellbeing - After minor surgery earlier this year, I was forced to reconsider how I do/don't take care of myself. Found a diet that has worked wonders, am back to running every other day and am 3lb off shedding 2 stone that I've carried around for the last 8 years.Self Accountability - I've been clearer on WHEN I intend to achieve the goals I set for myself and the business has been a game changer. I've been holding myself more accountable and it is clear to see the positive change this has made.I haven't completed my full reflection of the year as yet, there's still just under 2 weeks left of our working month so we are still all hands on deck supporting our clients to achieve and plan exceptional events.What #goalsetting do you put in place for yourself and your business?#business #businesswomen #goals #businessplanning

Post Text: Let's just stop for a second ‚úãÔ∏èüõëLife can be way too hectic at times.Mental Health Awareness Week is¬†an annual event where there is an opportunity for the whole of the UK to focus on achieving good mental health.This year's theme is 'anxiety', with the week running from 15 to 21 May 2023.Not just this week but every week its so important to make sure we take time to check our own and others mental health.The same as you would check how others are feeling after any other illness.Anxiety affects each and every one of us to varying degrees.How we respond and act also affects and influences those around us, especially if you have children.Believe it or not, from a very early age I suffered with anxiety, which has manifested itself in many different ways over the years.Traumas big or small will do that sometimes and if not managed in the right way can spiral out of control.Watching Matt and Emma Willets documentary last night about battling Matts addiction - a huge eye opener and so very brave but important to share.Everything we do has consequences good or bad.It's so important to talk through any issues or anxieties you may be feeling.We never really know what people are going through and it's so important to show up and ask genuinely if the are 'ok'.We are all human, it's important to talk through our anxieties after all a problem shared is a problem halved.No matter if its this week or the coming weeks, lets remember to #keeptalking#mha #mentalhealth #anxiety #events #tohelpmyanxiety #mentalhealthawarenessweek

Post Text: On this #worldmentalhealthdayWhat are you planning to do to make a positive difference?For yourself, for others?You see, each and every day (and not just this day).I have daily rituals I try to uphold.Since the lockdowns, these rituals have become my coping mechanisms with unknowns, challenges, grief and feeling uneasy about something.I try to listen to my body, recognise triggers.Reach out to support others.And retreat when I need to.I guess being an earth sign, I feel its important to feel grounded.I look at my goals daily, what are the challenges, what are the aspirations for the day/week ahead.I go for a run every other day around the park where I live, listening to audible (usually a business related book - currently working my way through Steven Bartlett Diary of a CEO 33 laws - highly recommend!).Me and my husband walk every lunch time, keen to get away from our screens albeit for 20-30 minutes.Time with each other, discussing hopes, dreams and goals really helps to refocus both our attention.Weekly, I take solace in my garden it is undoubtedly one of my happiest places and where I feel closest to those who are no longer here.Why am I sharing this here today?Because, in a busy hectic world where everyone has their own agenda.It's important to have coping mechanisms, its also important to be Intune with our own mental health and those we care about.It's so easy to neglect this way of thinkingYou may feel you're invincible but I genuinely believe its one of the most important things that you can do.So what are your rituals? How do you put yourself and others first?Feel free to share them here üëá #mha #dailyrituals #metime #mentalhealthmatters

Post Text: Although today is the end of #mentalhealthawarenessweek It is also the end of #dementiaactionweek Both subjects incredibly important not just this week but every day.There are so many affected by both and yet many, unless they have experienced first hand may not anticipate how challenging it can be.You see, 9 years ago in July, I sadly lost my mother to vascular dementia.Grief has an unusual way of appearing when you least expect it.We visited our local library yesterday and on the #dementiaawarenessweek board was this beautiful poem.Yes, the tears fell, because it is exactly how life was 5 years before my mom passed.Then when she was gone, a year passed and my son was born, we always say he was a gift from her üíóIt's so important to look for the signs of dementia, because sometimes if caught early, there are meds that can slow things down. Sadly mom died aged 67, no age really.This is why I believe in trying to live my best life as much as I can because you never know what is around the corner.For any pointers on the best way to get diagnosis take a look here: https://lnkd.in/eS-_Q3zq#dementiaactionweek #dementiaawareness #missyoumom #dementia

Post Text: #happymonday one and all!How often do you wake up on a Monday morning excited about what the new week has to offer you?It took me 35 years to get to that point.I never really knew what I wanted to do.I worked as a Junior secretary at a recruitment firm straight from college at 18.Then decided I wanted to become a recruitment consultant and spent another couple of years trying to persuade my existing employer that was the path I wanted to go down and they should train me to retain me!In the end an independent agency took me under their wing. The Sales Director at the time told me, if I did all their sales admin, she would train me up. She kept her word and I went on to be a successful recruitment consultant winning Young Business person of the year award age 21.All moments to be proud of, but I still couldn't settle, moved to a national agency and in the end decided after 6 years recruitment wasn't for me.Then I got bitten with the hospitality and events bug, my first ever role Junior sales exec for Birmingham City FC I'll never forget my first ever football match, the electric atmosphere and the wonderful clients who I'm still in touch with to this day.You guessed it, as much as I thrived in this environment I wanted to climb the ladder...my story goes on further.My point is every single role I've ever worked in, has lead to a stepping stone of where I am now. Years of experience serving amazing clients venue side.Has given me the experience and knowledge to serve Sheer Edge clients further.Not only that, some of the members of our team are from the hospitality and events industry, we have a group of #eventprofs who are as passionate about service levels as we are.I'm 7 years into my forever role, there's much to do, it's not been easy but it's exactly what I'm meant to be doing.To me it's way more than just a job. It's creating memorable experiences, exceptional events that last a lifetime.I've found my purpose and will continue to fulfil it until I'm not needed anymore and I'm hoping the legacy will continue without me.How do you feel about what you do? Are you happy it's Monday and a new week?#work #events #careerpath #legacy #businessleader

Post Text: How often do you have fire in your belly about something?Over the years, I have always found that if something is not ethical in my view, I struggle to go along with it.The tough part?Not everyone agrees, or holds the same values as you.We are extremely lucky, as a business owner, I've found these instances crop up a lot less frequently.However, today, one has popped up.I wonder when 'anti-competition laws' will actually be taken seriously within the #corporatehospitality sector?For those who are unclear of these laws here's an overview!In the UK¬†anti-competitive behaviour is prohibited under Chapters I and II of the Competition Act 1998 (the Act) and may be prohibited under Articles 81 and 82 of the EC Treaty. These laws prohibit anti-competitive agreements between businesses and the abuse of a dominant position in a market.Sadly, venues sell out to whomever is offering them the best price (obvs) In some instances, it can become almost impossible to do right by your customers.I'm left fuming today, over something I have very little control over.Rant over... We will and always will, find a way.Always going above and beyond for our clients that will never, ever change.In life there will always be challenges.It's important we learn to overcome them and do right by all.#dotherightthing #anticompetitionlaw #competition
